title: Picropodophyllin induces ferroptosis via blockage of AKT/NRF2/SLC7A11 and AKT/NRF2/SLC40A1 axes in hepatocellular carcinoma as a natural IGF1R inhibitor.
abstract: Ferroptosis represents a distinct form of regulated cell death characterized by intracellular iron overload and extensive lipid peroxidation. Targeting ferroptosis-related signaling pathways and inducing ferroptosis have emerged as promising therapeutic strategies for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). Recent studies have highlighted the involvement of insulin-like growth factor 1 receptor (IGF1R) signaling in cancer progression and antioxidant defense mechanisms. Picropodophyllin (PPP), a natural IGF1R inhibitor isolated from Dysosma versipellis, exhibits anticancer effects against several solid tumors. However, the impact of PPP on ferroptosis in HCC and the underlying molecular mechanisms remain unclear.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
